name: Navier AI
headline: Real-Time CFD Simulations
description:
Navier AI is making CFD 1000x faster with their ML-based solver.

Physics simulations, such as Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), are essential across many industries ranging from the design and analysis of aircraft, to weather prediction, to the development of medical devices. Today’s simulation tools use explicit numerical solvers for physical equations, such as the Naiver-Stokes equations. These solvers are complex to setup and can take ages to produce results.

Navier AI is building 1000x faster simulations using physics-ML solvers. Navier AI's fast CFD platform will enable engineers to quickly explore design spaces and perform analysis-in-the-loop design optimization. They are lowering the barrier to entry for aerospace and mechanical engineers to create high performance designs.

founders.name: Cameron Flannery, Founder
founders.description:
Cameron is an Aerospace Engineer and the cofounder of Navier AI. Cameron has built rocket engines, satellites, hydrofoiling containerships, and autonomous trucks in his career at some of the top engineering companies in the world. 

Formerly at SpaceX, Tesla, Aurora Innovation, Astranis, and Boundary Layer Technologies.

founders.name: Evan Kay, Founder
founders.description: Evan is an Aerospace Engineer and the co-founder of Navier AI. Evan formerly worked at SpaceX and General Atomics, where he was designing and metal 3D printing rocket engine and aircraft components. Prior to Navier AI, Evan was also a hard tech investor at Anzu Partners, where he invested in early-stage industrial technologies.

# 
Run Real-Time CFD
with Navier AI's Physics-ML Solver
[Learn more](http://navier.ai/<https:/372pdei9rv7.typeform.com/to/kdd7VHRt>)
Technology
## 
Real-Time CFD
# Computational Fluid Dynamics
Physics simulations, such as Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), are essential across many industries ranging from the design and analysis of aircraft, to weather prediction, to the development of medical devices. Today’s simulation tools use explicit numerical solvers for physical equations, such as the Navier-Stokes equations. These solvers are complex to setup and can take ages to produce results.
# Physics ML
Navier AI is building 1000x faster simulations using our physics-ML solver. Our model is trained on massive amounts of high-quality simulations and fine-tuned on experimental data. High precision and accuracy are required for engineering simulations and are core drivers for our product.
Our fast CFD platform will enable engineers to quickly explore design spaces and perform analysis-in-the-loop design optimization. We are lowering the barrier to entry for aerospace and mechanical engineers to create high performance designs. 
![](http://navier.ai/_ipx/_/doe_workflow.png)

generated_description:
### Navier AI: Revolutionizing CFD Simulations

Founded in 2023 and part of Y Combinator's Winter '24 batch, **Navier AI** is on a mission to revolutionize computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations, making them **1000x faster** than traditional methods. The company is spearheaded by a small but capable team, including co-founders Cameron Flannery and Evan Kay, both of whom have impressive backgrounds with companies like SpaceX and Tesla.

#### What is Navier AI Doing?

At its core, Navier AI is taking the complex world of physics simulations—vital for industries like aerospace, medicine, and environmental science—and simplifying it through advanced machine learning techniques. Traditional CFD tools can be cumbersome and time-consuming, often requiring extensive setup and processing power. With Navier AI's innovative **physics-ML solver**, engineers can rapidly conduct simulations, enabling quicker design iterations and optimizations.

This speed not only enhances the design process but also lowers barriers for aerospace and mechanical engineers, allowing them to achieve high-performance designs more efficiently. 

#### Why It Matters

In practical terms, their technology will empower engineers to explore design spaces without the lengthy wait times associated with traditional simulation methods. Faster simulations mean more ideas can be tested, ultimately leading to better-performing products—whether that’s a new aircraft design or a more effective medical device.

#### The Team

Navier AI operates with a nimble team of just two employees, but they bring a wealth of experience from elite engineering backgrounds. The mentorship from Y Combinator and access to industry networks further bolster their potential.

#### Final Thoughts

Navier AI exemplifies how up-and-coming startups can leverage cutting-edge AI technology to solve longstanding engineering challenges. By drastically reducing the time to run CFD simulations, they’re not just changing the game; they’re opening up a whole new realm of possibilities for design innovation.

For more information, you can check out their [official website](http://navier.ai).
